001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.encoder;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorEx;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple;
005import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.ElapsedTime;
006import com.technototes.library.hardware.motor.EncodedMotor;
007import com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor.Sensor;
008
009/**
010 * Wraps a motor instance to provide corrected velocity counts and allow reversing independently of the corresponding
011 * slot's motor direction
012 */
013public class MotorEncoder extends Sensor<DcMotorEx> implements Encoder {
014
015    private static final int CPS_STEP = 0x10000;
016    public int offset = 0;
017
018    private static double inverseOverflow(double input, double estimate) {
019        double real = input;
020        while (Math.abs(estimate - real) > CPS_STEP / 2.0) {
021            real += Math.signum(estimate - real) * CPS_STEP;
022        }
023        return real;
024    }
025
026    @Override
027    public double getSensorValue() {
028        return getCurrentPosition();
029    }
030
031    @Override
032    public void zeroEncoder() {
033        offset = motor.getCurrentPosition();
034    }
035
036    public enum Direction {
037        FORWARD(1),
038        REVERSE(-1);
039
040        private int multiplier;
041
042        Direction(int multiplier) {
043            this.multiplier = multiplier;
044        }
045
046        public int getMultiplier() {
047            return multiplier;
048        }
049    }
050
051    private DcMotorEx motor;
052    private ElapsedTime clock;
053
054    private Direction direction;
055
056    private int lastPosition;
057    private double velocityEstimate;
058    private double lastUpdateTime;
059
060    public MotorEncoder(DcMotorEx motor, ElapsedTime clock) {
061        super(motor);
062        // motor.setMode(DcMotor.RunMode.RUN_USING_ENCODER);
063        this.motor = motor;
064        this.clock = clock;
065        clock.reset();
066
067        this.direction = Direction.FORWARD;
068
069        this.lastPosition = 0;
070        this.velocityEstimate = 0.0;
071        this.lastUpdateTime = clock.seconds();
072    }
073
074    public MotorEncoder(DcMotorEx motor) {
075        this(motor, new ElapsedTime());
076    }
077
078    public MotorEncoder(EncodedMotor<DcMotorEx> motor) {
079        this(motor.getDevice());
080    }
081
082    public MotorEncoder(String deviceName) {
083        this(hardwareMap.get(DcMotorEx.class, deviceName));
084    }
085
086    public Direction getDirection() {
087        return direction;
088    }
089
090    private int getMultiplier() {
091        return (
092            getDirection().getMultiplier() *
093            (motor.getDirection() == DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD ? 1 : -1)
094        );
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Allows you to set the direction of the counts and velocity without modifying the motor's direction state
099     * @param direction either reverse or forward depending on if encoder counts should be negated
100     */
101    public void setDirection(Direction direction) {
102        this.direction = direction;
103    }
104
105    public MotorEncoder invert() {
106        setDirection(getDirection() == Direction.FORWARD ? Direction.REVERSE : Direction.FORWARD);
107        return this;
108    }
109
110    public int getCurrentPosition() {
111        int multiplier = getMultiplier();
112        int currentPosition = (motor.getCurrentPosition() - offset) * multiplier;
113        if (currentPosition != lastPosition) {
114            double currentTime = clock.seconds();
115            double dt = currentTime - lastUpdateTime;
116            velocityEstimate = (currentPosition - lastPosition) / dt;
117            lastPosition = currentPosition;
118            lastUpdateTime = currentTime;
119        }
120        return currentPosition;
121    }
122
123    public double getRawVelocity() {
124        int multiplier = getMultiplier();
125        return motor.getVelocity() * multiplier;
126    }
127
128    public double getCorrectedVelocity() {
129        return inverseOverflow(getRawVelocity(), velocityEstimate);
130    }
131}
